image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and scarf and a man in a suit with a red tie.

props.synopsis: As counting in this ACT seat nears an end, many are wondering what its results mean for the territory, the country and the Liberal Party.

title.children: Labor's David Smith pulls ahead but seat of Bean still too close to call

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Chief Justice Lucy McCallum described the perpetrator's actions as "extremely serious" adding the impact on the victim had been "grave".

title.children: 'Permanently scarred': Canberra man who slashed woman with sword jailed

image.altText: the exterior of the ACT Supreme Court

props.synopsis: Family members of two teenagers killed in a crash in Canberra last January tell a court they've been broken by the loss, after the 14-year-old driver ran a red light in a stolen car and collided with a ute.

title.children: Canberra mother of teen killed in crash 'numb and struggling to live'

image.altText: A brick church with a sign saying 'All are welcome in this place'.

props.synopsis: Churches in Canberra and Newcastle are expelled from their denominational association after refusing to support a conservative stance on same-sex marriage.

title.children: Canberra Baptist Church expelled from association over same-sex marriage support

image.altText: David smiles talking to two people.

props.synopsis: Labor has had few blemishes on its electoral record in the history of ACT federal representation. But last night, a fresh independent wave swept over Canberra, making life tougher for both major parties.

title.children: ACT voters show once again there's no such thing as a safe seat

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and black top stands in front of a Telstra phone box in Narooma.

props.synopsis: As bushfires raged on the NSW south coast, this public phone box became a link to the outside world. Residents want to see it listed on the National Trust Heritage Register.

title.children: 'Unconventional' campaign to have phone boxes heritage listed

image.altText: Grey-haired man in his 60's, wearing cap, smiling, arms on fence, dairy cows in background

props.synopsis: A fourth-generation dairy farmer is using a world-first genetic index to breed heat tolerant cattle, with his animals grazing in hot, sticky conditions and producing large quantities of commercial-grade milk.

title.children: Farmer breeds heat tolerant cows thanks to Australian invention

image.altText: Diana Ross with massive white headpiece, and long wedding-esque train, photographers behind her

props.synopsis: Diana Ross hasn't attended a Met Gala since 2003, but made sure no-one would forget she was there this year. Here are some of the key moments and styles from the 2025 high-fashion fundraising event.

title.children: Key moments from the Met Gala include Diana Ross's show-stopping gown

image.altText: Ken Wyatt looks directly at the camera on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A former Liberal elder who spectacularly quit the party after leaving federal parliament lashes his previous colleagues, urging them to change or risk becoming a "lesser party" in the wake of another bruising election result.

title.children: 'Wake up': Former Liberal elder lashes party, warns long recovery ahead

image.altText: Two small boys, with faces blurred, in a karate class.

props.synopsis: The Coonabarabran community in north-west NSW is in shock today after the "incomprehensible" deaths of two boys aged six and seven.

title.children: Grandmother likely to face 'serious charges' after deaths of two young boys

image.altText: A man wearing an American Badass t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Most Greenlanders oppose the US president's threats to invade, but some believe it could give them leverage in their fight for independence from Denmark.

title.children: Greenland's problem? 'Not enough MAGA hats' to go around

image.altText: An aerial shot of a film studio complex featuring many large warehouse-like buildings.

props.synopsis: Shock waves have been sent through the domestic film industry after US President Donald Trump announced his intention to slap a 100 per cent tariff on films "produced in foreign lands".

title.children: Trump's film tariffs throws Gold Coast vision into doubt, industry says

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: The NSW Crime Commission will reconsider pursuing Labor minister Eddie Obeid over $30 million he made from a corrupt coal deal after premier promises additional resources.

title.children: Crime commission to look at new ways of retrieving Obeid's 'ill gotten gains'

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: America has decided to sever its trading relationship with China — a strategy that ultimately will come at enormous cost. And Australia, more than any other nation, will be caught smack in the middle.

title.children: The world is becoming a dangerous place. Australia is caught in the middle

image.altText: Bejnamin Netanyahu wearing a navy jacket, white shirt and a gold and Israeli flag lapel pin while grimacing

props.synopsis: Israel has approved plans to seize the Gaza Strip and stay in the Palestinian territory for an unspecified amount of time, Israeli officials say.

title.children: Palestinians would be moved to Gaza's south under 'intensive' Israeli plan

image.altText: Electric vehicle plugged into a charger on a tree-lined city street.

props.synopsis: As new electric vehicle sales rise, more EVs are entering the used-car market. Are used-EV batteries any good, and how can you check?

title.children: How long can you expect a battery to last in a second-hand EV?

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: A flat battery has led two alleged e-bike hoons into the long arm of the law after a helicopter was used to track them on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Teenagers clocked going 120kph on e-bike but no charges laid

image.altText: Bad Bunny with his shirt off in front of a wood paneled wall.

props.synopsis: Hugely popular rapper and singer Bad Bunny has confirmed he will play his first Australian date as part of a huge, 12-month world tour.

title.children: One of music's biggest stars announces first Australian show

image.altText: Woman in green shirt smiles leaning on man in white shirt who also smiles. A piano is in the background.

props.synopsis: Richard Tognetti is exacting, virtuosic and at the helm of one of the world's best chamber orchestras. He sits down with Virginia Trioli to talk work ethic, what brings him joy and what irks him.

title.children: Why the head of one of the world's best orchestras still worries about scales

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: Local shares slipped backwards on Tuesday, while data showed building approvals fell by 8.8 per cent in March. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX closes slightly lower, building approvals dropped by 8.8pc in March — as it happened

image.altText: A Channel 7 Tasmania sign, with a bush of flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Media conglomerate Seven West Media strikes a deal with Southern Cross Media Group to buy media assets, including some in Tasmania, after a deal with a conservative media group fell apart.

title.children: Seven West Media to buy Tasmania's Channel 7 and other Southern Cross TV assets

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: Australian voters have overwhelmingly chosen household batteries over nuclear, rejecting the Coalition's anti-renewables agenda.

title.children: Solar uptake a clue to why Australians chose batteries over nuclear

image.altText: Elvis Smylie plays a shot

props.synopsis: Rising star Elvis Smylie has boosted Australia's US PGA Championship tilt to seven after earning a late special exemption to golf's second major of 2025.

title.children: Smylie gets US PGA Championship chance

image.altText: Justis Huni poses, leaning on the top rope of a boxing ring

props.synopsis: After a tumultuous five-year career, Justis Huni is positioned to become just the third Australian to fight for the undisputed heavyweight world boxing title.

title.children: Huni 'comfortable being me' ahead of momentous opportunity

image.altText: A woman in a light-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Newly-elected SA MP Claire Clutterham says her varied career — including an international role as a lawyer — has prepared her for her new role as the first woman to represent the seat of Sturt in Adelaide's eastern suburbs.

title.children: Newly elected MP who defied her own party's polling

image.altText: Photo collage Peter Dutton, Michael Sukkar, David Coleman and Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: And it's dealt a serious blow to their pipeline of future leadership talent.

title.children: The Liberals' suburban wipe-out has complicated leadership discussions

image.altText: Palmer scratches his head.

props.synopsis: Despite spending $60 million on campaign advertisements, Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has failed to win a single seat in the lower house.

title.children: After millions of dollars and texts, Trumpet of Patriots fails to deliver

image.altText: Traffic jam on M1 north of Sydney after hundreds of cars get flat tyres

props.synopsis: The transport company at the centre of a scrap metal spill on the M1 motorway is counting the cost with more than 1,000 claims so far for tyre damage.

title.children: M1 scrap metal spill damage bill rises as drivers claim tyre repairs

image.altText: A stingray barb that was removed from the arm of Minlaton woman Pam Bennett.

props.synopsis: A volunteer marine researcher looking into marine deaths along South Australia's coastline was rushed to hospital after her arm was skewered by a 16-centimetre stingray barb. Yesterday, a dead white shark washed up on an Adelaide beach, with testing being conducted to determine a cause.

title.children: 'Not their normal behaviour': Snorkeler speared by stingray

image.altText: A portable toilet dumped in scrub.

props.synopsis: After a popular rest stop on WA's South Coast Highway was left looking like a landfill, locals and drivers are urging travellers to do better.

title.children: Illegal campers leave 'unbelievable mess' by WA highway

image.altText: Mike Bush speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Victoria's new police commissioner Mike Bush says he will focus on crime prevention and lifting officer morale.

title.children: New top cop Mike Bush to make significant changes to Victoria Police

image.altText: Josh Giddey with Benny's Boys players after a social game in Franskton.

props.synopsis: A social basketball team in Frankston did a double take when they saw Chicago Bulls star Josh Giddey suiting up for the opposition on Monday night.

title.children: 'This game's not going to go our way': NBA star crashes social game in Melbourne

image.altText: An old lady sits, leaning on a wall as she holds an empty metal pot.

props.synopsis: As people queue for hours for a bowl of soup, Israel maintains its blockade of food and aid — and the groups keeping people fed warn their supplies are running out.

title.children: Outside Gaza sits 116,000 tonnes of food as people inside run out

image.altText: An anonymous cardinal wearing bright red robes with gold accents looks up.

props.synopsis: In its 800-year history, a conclave has never been this diverse. How will this changing face of Catholicism impact the result of the papal vote?

title.children: 'He's one of us': Catholics around the world are watching the conclave

image.altText: An elderly woman holding the hand of her adult son on a sidewalk

props.synopsis: Estate planning before your own death can be confronting for anyone. But for parents who have children with disabilities, there are additional complexities to consider.

title.children: Dan used to care for his 95yo mum. Now it's the other way around
